column2: Will Never be Unlocked. Exists to prevent crashing
Will Never be Unlocked. Exists to prevent crashing
The stoneworkers of a Masonry use rocks to produce cut stone, which are used as building material.
A Glassmithery uses coal to make glass that can be made into beer and wine glasses.
A Blast Furnace melts ore with coal to produce a stronger alloy. This metal is needed to make any swords or armor worthy of a soldier.
A Sawmill takes raw timber and converts it into lumber used in buildings.
Like a Cotton Weavers' Guild, a Wool Weavers' Guild produces fabric needed for any clothes and sails that use wool and dye.
Like a Wool Weavers' Guild, a Cotton Weavers' Guild produces fabric needed for any clothes and sails that use cotton and dye.
The Brewery uses glass and local fermented crops to make alcohol craved by any person after a hard day's work.
A Paper Mill uses timber to produce paper needed by bureaucrats and loremasters for their daily jobs.
Guild artisans with a talent for Poetry and Storytelling compose literature, which the wealthier people enjoy.
When supplied with lumber, a Carpenters' Guild produces furniture.
When supplied with dye, lumber and fabric, the employed guild artisans produce luxury furniture coveted by any person for their quality and comfort.
Fabric is used in a Tailor's Guild to produce clothes.
Guild artisans with a particular talent use dye and fabric to produce luxury clothes coveted by any person for their quality and comfort.
A Smithy employs blacksmiths to make weapons, armors, and shields out of metals that are usable for melee combat.
A Fletchers' Guild uses iron and lumber to produce bows and arrows. These weapons are a daily need for any army with archers.
A siegeyard uses rocks, metals and lumber to produce siege engines such as ballistas, catapults, and trebuchets. These war machines can be a powerful tool against armies and structures alike.
Lumber and fabric are used to make ships, which not only have a purpose in the Navy, but can also be used by wealthy citizens as part of their luxurious life.
